thread.title: 9 tweets which sum up how happy the world is that the last international break of the season is over
thread.title_full: 9 tweets which sum up how happy the world is that the last international break of the season is over

author: Jon Moody
title: 9 tweets which sum up how happy the world is that the last international break of the season is over
text:
9 tweets which sum up how happy the world is that the last international break of the season is over Rejoice, "real football" fans - the Premier League is on its way back! Share The front of Lukaku's shirt says "I hate the international break" (Photo: Getty) Share Get daily     
Ten down, three to go. 
That's how many days there is left until Premier League action resumes - and it's fair to say most football fans have been keeping that very count in their heads since the international break began the weekend before last. 
Sure, it's pretty a relatively interesting fortnight as international breaks go. We saw the controversial use of video technology in France vs Spain , Jamie Vardy "wearing eyeliner" and Cristiano Ronaldo have an airport named after himself. 
But as we know, nothing truly replaces the Premier League during this time, and the fact that the rude interruption to the season is now done and dusted has had people jumping for joy. "WE'RE FREE! FREE OF MEANINGLESS FRIENDLIES!" (Photo: Plumb Images) 
We are now full steam ahead on the run-in and fans are very, very excited. 
We've scanned through the noise to bring you the nine best tweets which sum up planet Earth's thoughts at the news "real" football is on its way back... 
Hard to disagree with their reactions, isn't it? 
As a bonus aside, one Chelsea fan couldn't help but stick the knife into their faltering rivals a little bit more... We can't wait you have you back, Prem - we've missed you! Like us on Facebook
